text:
Aroma : overwhelming bourbon - vanilla, coconut, marzipan, with medium malty butterscotch, some raisins and apricots. 
Appearance: caramel-like with no head at all
Taste: sweet, a tiny bit boozy, maltiness is a bit more pronounced than in aroma, but barrel deos not forfeit this fight, both sources of taste are very pronounced and intense. 
Overall: Hype well deserved, wish I could afford a whole cellar of this stuff.

Butelka 375ml (vintage 2016). Barwa ciemna, wpadająca w brunatną, nieprzejrzysta. Pianę tworzy cienki, beżowy kożuszek, niezbyt trwała ale cienki pierścień wokół ścianek szkła utrzymuje się bardzo długo. Aromat zdecydowanie beczkowy, intensywny z nutami drewnianymi i słodkiej wanilii, słodowy, bardzo przyjemny. W smaku przyjemna, słodka, waniliowa słodycz z lekko szczypiącym na języku alkoholem i wyraźnym pieczeniem w przełyku plus solidne rozgrzewanie od środka. Piwo solidnie słodowe, gęste, świetnie zbalansowane, gładkie nawet mimo lekkiego alko, który całkiem dobrze się komponuje z całością mimo swojej wyraźnej obecności. Nie przeszkadza a po kilku łykach już go nie czuć w ogóle, jak dla mnie w granicy tolerancji. Piwo zdecydowanie może sporo zyskać na leżakowaniu.

Flaska från Beergium, vintage 2014(?). Mörk mahognybrun, lätt murken med beiget, halvfinger högt skum. Doft av mörk torkad frukt, fikon, bourbon, massor av ek, lönnsirap, kolaremmar och sherry. Massiv, oljig kropp med en väldigt värmande alkoholton, spritig. Mycket bourbon i smaken men främst en väldigt tydlig fatkaraktär där ektonerna tar över lite väl. I övrigt torkad frukt, melass. Snustorr avslutning. Mja, den här var långt under förväntningarna. Spritig och spretig, håller inte riktigt ihop, överdrivet ekig. Saknar även djup och komplexitet, inget vidare samspel mellan smakerna och dofterna. Förväntade mig bra mycket mer.
Aromat fajnie beczkowy - kokos, wanilia. Nie jakoś mega intensywnie. Potem wychodzi alko, które zaburza cały odbiór.

Aroma of oak and sweet malt, some dark sweet fruit. Appearance is muddy brown, little to no head.Taste is very sweet caramel, some oak, dark fruits, little to no carbonation, works well for the style. Solid beer, reminds me of some of the Hair of the Dog beers.
Bijna de pure perfectie. Dik vol mondgevoel. Licht boozy. Caramel, donker fruit, licht plakkerig. Tegen de port aan. Graag nog een fles !!

Bottle from trade

Dark brown pour with thin head. Nose of bourbon, sweet malts, figs and caramel. Flavor is somewhat oaky with chocolate, vanilla and roasted malts. Very nice.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking an Angels Share Bourbon Barrel-Aged by The Lost Abbey 

Migdaly, wanilia, susz, rodzynki, karmel, kandyzowane cuda, ciut uszczypliwe alko, geste, lepkie, slodkie i ciut kwaskowate, super skomponowane

Rami Rami: Aha, to to z nowa etka w sensie wiekszym obrazkiem, czyli 2016 chyba

Rami Rami: Ten alko glownie pozostaje w posmakach, taki szczypiacy me delikutasne usteczko, minusik do gwiazdekRami Rami is drinking an Angels Share Bourbon Barrel Aged (2017) by The Lost Abbey at Grochów

Boskie piwo tylko powinno trafic na lezak bo alko. Wiec teraz tylko ocenka jw, figi, rodzynki, wanilia.... ale mi i tak b pasuje, mimo alko

Aromat: mocny i cudowny, intensywny bourbon, ale nie nazbyt mocny, nie przykrywa pozostałych elementów. Oprócz bourbonu są tu rodzynki, słodkie suszone owoce, karmel, wanilia.
Wygląd: kolor bardzo ciemnej miedzi, prawie zupełnie nieprzejrzyste, ładna kawowa niewielka piana, szybko redukująca się do obwódki na szkle.
Smak: likierowa słodycz, oleiste, gęste, o konkretnej teksturze, bardzo rozgrzewające. Smak niesamowicie bogaty, jest likierowy bourbon, ale bardzo dobrze wkomponowany, nie przykrywający innych smaków. Są słodkie suszone owoce- rodzynki, figi, śliwki, wiśnie, sporo wanilii od beczki, karmel, czekolada, w kontrze do słodyczy ostry posmak beczki po bourbonie, powodujący przyjemne szczypanie w język w posmaku, troszkę palonego karmelu. Balans doskonały, beczka idealnie wpasowana, odczucie w ustach świetne, alkohol świetnie przykryty. Doskonałe piwo, światowa klasa

Bottle from Healthy Spirits Castro. Dark brown color, minimal beige head. Bitter taste with caramel, toffee, oak, bourbon, alcohol, resin and dark fruits. Bitter finish with caramel, toffee, oak, bourbon, alcohol, dark fruits and wood. Exquisite barley wine, but quite boozy.

butelka. ciemnobrązowe, niemal czarne, z obfitą, drobnopęcherzykową, brudnobiałą pianą utrzymującą się do końca picia. w aromacie drewno, marcepan, wanilia, słodowość, rodzynki, figi, aromat niezwykle intensywny i wciągający, po ogrzaniu wyraźny aromat szlachetnego alkoholu. w smaku pełne, wyklejające, gładkie, bogate na finiszu w owocowość, słodkie, świetnie ułożony alkohol, rozgrzewający przełyk. na pewno najlepsze piwo jakie dotychczas piłem

Bottle gifted by Benzo! Pours deep opaque burgundy-brown with virtual no head. Aroma is caramel laden. Heaps of caramel in the taste, balanced by a moderate bitterness with some molasses thrown in. Oak, raisins, dates, and a tinge of vanilla make up the rest of this beers character. Thick, oily body.

375ml bottle from Super Deli & Grocery, Seattle. Vintage 2016. Pours a very dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is bourbon, sweet fruits. Taste is chocolate, bourbon, dark fruits, some bourbon barrel. Slightly hot. Very nice.

2015 vintage. Pours a deep brownish black with thin ring of bubbly tan head that leaves light lace. Aroma and taste of strong bourbon notes, vanilla and oak, over hints of dark fruit and a very mild roastiness. Booze is pretty high, but solid beer nonetheless.
The aroma of bourbon and fruitiness. Just a taste of bourbon. Okay bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Not so good beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Mistrzowskie piwo. Aromat jest wręcz obłędny. Uderza wanilia, marcepan i migdały. na drugim planie mleczna czekolada i wiśnia.
Piana niezbyt okazała. Kolor ciemnobrązowy / czarny.
Niezwykle treściwe i gładkie. Przyjemna konsystencja. W smaku odrobina czekolady, likieru, troszkę karmelu i kawy. Subtelne nuty burbonowe.

Rozgrzewa w przełyku. pijalne.

12.7 oz bottle. 2016 vintage. Pours black with light head. Aromas of light bourbon, dark brown sugar/caramel, oak, and sweet roasted malts. Smooth flavors of sweet bourbon, light oaky whiskey, dry dark caramel, and sweet sticky roasted malts with a hint of chocolate. A little hot, but overall nicely balanced for a young barleywine.

(bottle 2 years old)
Aroma:bourbon,vanilla,coconut,chocolate, barrel note.
Appearance:dark brown color,small dense head.
Taste:sweet,flavour of vanilla,chocolate,coconut,caramel,anise sweet coconut0-like finish.
Overall:One of the best barley wines i have ever tried, huge barrel notes strikes you with every sip , Pure good in beer form. Yummy!!

Bottle. Aroma: Very rich, complex, every sip is a new experience. Vanilla, coconut, marzipan, almonds, raisins, bourbon. In taste bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, cocoa, marzipan. Masterpiece, veryr rich beer, complex, every sip is an adventure and incredible pleasure.

Bottle from Belmont Station.

A: Dark mahogany near to black. Ring of cappuccino head. Legs.

N: Thick caramel, some toffee, and plenty of bourbon, oak, and vanilla. Light coffee with some more roast. Theres some cherry underneath here, as well as some raisin and fig.

T: Sweet with just a touch of bitterness. Plenty of oaky tannins.

M: Medium-heavy body, no alcohol, subtle, but present carbonation.

O: Damn this is nice. Really well-balanced. I remember when this was a big deal. After the fight over carbonation, this lost of a lot of prestige. Entirely undeserved. Delicious.
Z: Kokos, Wanilia. Słodko, przyjemnie. S: Slodko, wanilia, kokos. Finisz w fajny bourbon.
W zapachu subtelny kokos i wanilia + trochę alkoholu. W smaku kokos z wanilią zdecydowanie dominują, niemniej alkohol jest wyczuwalny.
Pours dark brown. The aroma is rich and full of caramel. Taste is deep: caramel, raisins bourbon. Long aftertaste. Best beer I have ever had.

Dark brown, almost no head. Medium to full bodied. Liquid raisins, caramel, bourbon, oak, sweet fruits, red fruits, a little bit of roast and coffee, just a tiny bit of smoke, tones of Port, honey, vanilla. Incredibly gentle and subtle. Very complex, new things keep coming up. Mostly sweet with a bitter finish, very balanced. Wow, just wow.

Unclear, murky brown color, small brown head. Some lees. Sweet aromas of raisins, figs, dates, alcohol, syrup, wood, vanilla, bourbon and liqueur. Taste of dried fruits, bourbon barrel, wood, licorice, alcohol and punch with a slight tart and alcoholic finish.

(Lost Abbey The Angels Share - Bourbon Barrel) Bottle 375ml, corked and caged. Into a snifter, ABV 12.5%
Dark brown colour on the body, kind of muddy, with a minimal light beige head on top.
Aroma has lots of bourbon, vanilla, caramel, figs, raisins, alcohol.
Taste follows, bourbon, toasted malts, caramel, light vanilla, dark fruits.
Medium thick body, soft carbpnation.
Great.

37.5cl bottle courtesy of Gyhallmanti. Appearance: dark brown with a tan rim of foam. Aroma: bourbon, raisins, coffee, caramel fudge, kahlua, vanilla and cocos. Taste: high sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of coffee, bourbon, vanilla, caramel, wood, pistache and some dried fruits. Palate: full bodied, creamy to oily texture and soft carbonation. Very good and complex

37.5 cl bottle split with SimonBlok. Pours a pitchblack colour with no head. Although a bit of foam creeps up against the glass. Aroma of dark malts, candy sugar, caramel, bourbon, vanilla, wood, alcohol, chocolate. Taste is fairly sweet, light bitter, slight sourness with a boozy and warming finish. Notes of liquorice, coffee, candy sugar, caramel, pistache/walnut, alcohol, wine acidity, dark malts, chocolate, umami. Texture is thick / creamy, full bodied with soft carbonation

Bottle. Pours dark brown, almost no head. Aroma: chocolate, toffee, burnt caramel,butterscotch, bourbon, sweet dark berries. Taste is sweet, caramel, toffee,butterscotch, bourbon, milk chocolate melted in coffee, some spicyness, Full body. Sweet finish. Warming alcohol. Well balanced. Really nice.

Bottle @ basement beer bar Aalborg. Aroma of lots of bourbon, caramel, oak, vanilla, mild chocolate, light boozy. Very dark brown with tan head. Taste is moderate sweet, light+ boozy and more bourbon. Full body, sweet oily feel and very bourbon hell.

Bottle
Aroma-dried fruits, prunes, vanilla, raisin, 
Appearance-brown, cloudy, minimal head, 
Taste-medium bitterness, medium sourness, light sweetness, 
Palate-full body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-perfect

Donker rood bruin bier met beige schuimkraag. Geur: karamel, vermolmd hout, noterig, vanille. Smaak: donker fruit, braambes, donkere chocolade van zon 60%, karamel, licht zoet, alcoholisch, vanille. Volmondig. Matige koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: licht zoet, alcoholisch, vanille.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2017 Bottle, 2016 batch. Poured into the Teku. 

Aroma: noble alcohol note, vanilla, a hint of nuts, a lot of raisins with a caramel twist and some port wine notes as well.

Pours very hazy, dark brown, with minimal head reducing very quickly. 

Medium to heavy sweetness, heavy bitterness (coming also from the alcohol), port wine (wow!) bourbon, caramel, figs, raisins. Very good. Delicious!

Full bodied, slick. Completely flat. Long aftertaste, mainly bourbon, vanilla, some prunes and raisins. Long oxidized alcohol (port wine).

This is an exquisite beverage but I guess it has to spend some more time in a bottle. For now - 9,2 out of 10. Very good, but not the best. 

EDIT: found another 2016 version - its so perfect. An extra soy sauce in aroma. Might be the case of month it was aged. Wow. 

Suggestion - it all depends on the particular barrel and the age it spent laying in the bottle IMO.

Aroma: vanilla, alcohol, caramel, oak, marshmallows, raisins, figs, toast
Taste: medium sweet, vanilla, alcohol, caramel, figs, marshmallows, oak
Bottle in trade from Joel, thanks! Dark pour. Huge bourbon aroma, some caramel. Taste follows, a little hot. Pretty good, under carbonated but still good.

Bottled. Pours dark fig color, off white head. Aroma is tons of fig, vanilla, toffee, maybe some honey, bourbon is light, some rum raisin, little bit of citrus or some bright notes. Flavor is bourbon, fig, vanilla, toffee, dark fruit, maybe plum, really good flavor, really prominent, not weak, or subdued. Really nice boozy burn in the back. Dang that bad boy is good. Maybe not as good as Goose island barleywine, but as far as barrel-aged barleywines go, well done.

Aromat beczki, wanilii, rodzynek, suszonych owoców, szlachetnego alkoholu, do tego karmel, toffi i ciasto karmelowe. W smaku podobnie - beczka wspaniale tutaj zapracowała. Piwo wielowymiarowe, mała butelka to spokojnie godzina przyjemności.

Ładne, gęste, zupełnie bez gazu. Aromat potężnie bourbonowy, mnóstwo beczki i wanilii. W smaku dość wyważone, wanilia, suszone owoce, daktyle, figi, rodzynki. Po ogrzaniu wychodzi lekka słodycz. Alkohol szlachetny, ale bardzo wyraźny - w subiektywnym odczuciu wydaje się znacznie mocniejsze, niż wskazuje na to procentowa zawartość alkoholu. Ogólnie piwo jest zdecydowanie wytrawne. Mimo gabarytów nie jest gęste ani zaklejające. Dość wymagające, do picia bardzo powoli i raczej na ciepło.
Very strong barrel and bourbon in the aroma. Alcohol is dominant through smell to after taste. A little bit of sweetness and bitterness. A light bourbon -> thats what it is.

W aromacie szlachetne nuty bourbonowe, słodowe, drewniane, utlenienie, wanilia, ładnie utrzymuje się do końca. W wyglądzie brąz wpadający w czerń, obrączka beżowej piany. W smaku bourbon, melasa, ciemne owoce, likierowość, rodzynki, śliwki, nuty drewniane, beczkowe, bardzo słodkie z lekką grejpfrutową goryczką. Ciało gęste, przyjemnie rozgrzewające, lekko alkoholowe. Ogólnie pyszny barley wine z wyrazistymi nutami beczkowymi, świetne piwo

Bottle. Teku. Deep brown with tiny, almost none head. Poor/none head retention and lacing. Aroma is huge, moderately to heavy malty - roasted, caramel, slightly chocolate. First of all huge bourbon notes, slightly boozy in the background. Also light to moderate dark fruits - prunes, raisins. Taste is moderately to highly sweet, long, stable broken by some nice light acidic notes. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, finish is bourbon, sweet, slightly boozy, slightly raisins and prunes. Slightly warming ABV. In overall outstanding brew with really strong influence of bourbon, not very sticky overloaded by malts like its used to be in most of BW. The only cons are for the appearance and boozy character. But believe me this one is worth every penny.

Refrigerated 12.7 oz. brown bottle poured into a snifter. Clear dark brow with very small beige head. Aroma is bourbon, medium body, low carbonation, and very little lacing. Taste is bourbon, vanilla, oak, and a little booze.

Aroma:

Heavy aroma of malts, caramel, wood, bourbon, vanilla, coconut, dried fruit, chocolate and roasted malts. 

Appearance:

Opaque dark brown beer with heavy yeast and with a slight/medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts heavy sweet with malts, caramel, wood, bourbon, vanilla, coconut, dried fruit and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. So much flavour, so much of everything. Those Heaven Hill barrels surely are the main attraction here, but there are still a lot of other flavours left. Simply amazing, nothing else to say.

Old rating rerated 09.12.2016, 0,375l bottle (2011 vintage?) shared with colleges @ work:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet mineraly, dark malts, burnt sugar, bourbon, minerals, oak, weeds, burnt caramel, grass, dark sugar, licorice, coffee, bark. Taste is slightly dry mineraly, dark malts, oak, dark sugar, minerals, bourbon, bark, burnt sugar, grass, licorice, rope, burnt caramel, coffee. Medium to longlasting bitterness, dry mineraly mouthfeel. Nice.

375 ml bottle from Systembolaget. APPEARANCE: deep brown with a small head. NOSE: strong aroma of bourbon, wood, caramel, fudge, brown sugar, dried fruits. TASTE: moderatly sweet, long and moderately bitter aftertaste. MOUTH: full body, with a smoth texture.

Pours opaque brown that seems to turn pink-brown toward the top of the glass...with sediment somehow evenly dispersed throughout. Smells strongly of bouron/whiskey/booze, wine and dry fruit. Tastes much the same as it smells, sweet and dry. It has a thick, full mouthfeel with slight carbonation. Excellent and different than any beer I have had.

(bottle) clear, bright, dark reddish brown colour with a small brown head; aroma of dried fruit, old wood; smooth palate; intense, balanced, dryish flavour, well hidden alcohol; long, light bitter finish

Pours black with almost no head. Aroma is vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, soy sauce and coffee. Flavour is heavy sweet, vanilla, light to medium bitter, malty, fruity, bourbon and herbal. Almost no carbonation at all. Slick and full.

Bottle from online web order. Poured a slight murky chesnut colour with a non lasting tanned ring. Nose of sweet caramel malts, toffee fudge, vanilla, sweet bourbon, marzipan and raisins. Taste is sweet and sticky with a big sweet bourbon finish. Medium bodied mouthfeel and a bit of a lack of Some carb. Pretty taste do
375ml bottle pours a dark brown color with a bit of head. Lots of bourbon flavor on some mild toffee. Very hot.

7 year old bottle shared by alexsdad06 pour opaque dark brown with thin ecru head. Nose Bourbon, vanilla, caramel, some dark fruit. Taste caramel, molasses, green apple, light barrel, vanilla and Bourbon. Held up reasonably well.

Bottle shared by Mart, thanks! Brown beer, minuscule tan head. Nose is "somebody poured beer in my bourbon", vanilla, oak, toasty notes, dried fruit. Flavor is sweet, vanilla, alcohol, bourbon, chocolate, caramel. Finishes with lots of booze and more booze.

Bottle (from beergium). Pours dark brown. Aroma is massive bourbon, vanilla, malt, caramel, alcohol. Flavor is sweet and bitter, caramel, vanilla, malt, bourbon. Finish is bourbon-malty-boozy. Drinkability is good. Overall: very good, but too boozy.

375ml bottle (thanks Mart). Clear chestnut color. Tiny size, brown head, stays. Bourbon, sweet, caramel, prunes and raisins in aroma. Raisins, caramel, sweet, woody in taste. Sweet and boozy in aftertaste. No carbonation. Very solid brew, but fckin boozy.

Style et résumé: Barley wine en fût de bourbon, trop bourbon. 
Comment: Petite bouteille avec bouchon de liège partagée. 
Description: Une robe brune avec une mousse beige. Un nez de whiskey, de bois, avec un caramel brûlé, tire éponge et vanille. La bouche est moins intéressante que le nez, mince en attaque mais ronde et liquoreuse en finale. Pas dalcool perceptible. Ordinaire et décevante. 
Note:  7/10

Gros splash de bourbon et de bois vert dès le départ mais heureusement que les démangeaisons grasses des malts et la vanille et les dattes et les fruits secs et les épices arrivent comme un baume sur une plaie qui saigne peu. Dommage cependant que le caramel, la mélasse et le chocolat sont si imbibés par leau-de-vie américaine une fois la première gorgée avalée et digérée. Les suivantes ne sont pas catastrophiques mais ne sont guère mieux. Boire une bière qui goûte trop le bourbon cest comme boire un bourbon qui goûte trop la bière. En bouche, le corps apparaît mince malgré cette texture semi-liquoreuse qui flatte mes papilles. En finale, bonne dose dalcool brun boisé.

Bottle thanks to Greg. It poured a dark brown color with a tan head. The aroma was of roast, vanilla, wood and whiskey. The taste was similar to the aroma with more sweet roasted malts, oak, vanilla and some booziness. Really good.
Dark brown. Smells like bourbon. Lots of bourbon. Dark fruit. If you like whiskey this is great. Thx ystbsm94. Tasted at dorans bottle share.

375 mL bottle shared with ebone1988. 2013 vintage. The pour is a light black. Its really dark with a thin collar of light khaki colored head and a couple spots of lace. The aroma is great. Lots of caramel malt and vanilla with a molasses and lovely bourbon barrel character. Light chocolate and good sweet molasses. This is going to be good. Its got a hint of booze as well. The flavor is great. There is a beautiful chocolate and molasses up front and a deep caramel malt and sweet vanilla that blends well with the bourbon barrel on the finish. The mouth feel is a little thin, but the carbonation is in point and the aftertaste is beautiful. Lingeringly sweet chocolate and caramel and molasses. This is great. Hot damn.

Bottle shared with koleminer20, yes. Vintage 2013. Aroma is caramel, molasses, bourbon, barrel, booze, butterscotch, spice, really really good. Appearance is dark brown, light tan head, mostly clear. Taste is caramel, wood, bourbon, smooth, toffee, molasses, really good. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, wood and caramel aftertaste. Overall, this is amazing.

2000th rating: 0.375 l bottle from Bierkompass, bottled in 2014. Pitch black with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, beige layer. Sweetish-malty, very inviting aroma of bourbon, raisins, vanilla, prunes, figs, caramel and a bit of oak. Quite sweet, malty and slightly alcoholic taste of lots of bourbon, caramel, dark honey, vanilla, raisins, prunes and figs, followed by a long, slightly bitter, moderately warming-alcoholic, minimally oaky finish. Medium to full body, slightly oily and only a little effervescent mouthfeel, very soft carbonation. Very complex, intense and perfectly balanced. Although the bourbon is very prominent, it fits in so well and accompanies the heavy base beer in a fantastic way. Huge beer!

Butelka. Oszałamiający aromat. Jest wanilia, karmel które razem tworzą bardziej aromat deseru niż piwa, trochę kojarzący mi się z ptasim mleczkiem toffee zalanym bourbonem. Z czasem dochodzą suszone owoce na czele z rodzynkami, choć da się też wyczuć wiśnie. Smak jest srednio słodki, mocno karmelowy, ale bardziej w typie toffee niż palonego cukru. Ogrom rodzynek, wiśni, śliwki, melasy, bourbonu. Wszystko fajnie zbudowane i zbalansowane, bez chaosu. W posmaku dochodzą nuty szlachetnego alkoholu które miło palą w gardło, dając znać o tym, że nie jest to lekkie piwerko i swoją wagę posiada. Ciało pełne, faktura oleista i zalepiająca, niskie do średniego wysycenie. Myślę że idealnie to piwo pasowało by do dobrego tytoniu w fajce. Mała butelka dla jednej osoby, to przynajmniej godzina świetnej przygody piwnej. Wybitna rzecz.
Bottle. Pours a brownish color. Aroma and taste are toffee, fruity, whiskey, and caramel.

Servida en un Spiegelau Tulip. APARIENCIA: de color marrón intenso casi negro, con algunos destellos más claros y cafés a contraluz; corona de espuma color beige de baja retención, de burbujas compactas y algunas abiertas.
AROMA: bourbon, bourbon, bourbon y más bourbon, coco tostado, vainilla, algo de madera, caramelo, toffee, algunos frutos oscuros maduros ligeramente. SABOR: al inicio del trago se siente dulce y presencia del alcohol, seguido del bourbon dominante nuevamente pero no tanto como en aroma, madera, vainilla y coco tostado se aprecian de manera marcada, inclusive en algunos tragos destaca muchísimo más esa nota a coco tostado; notas a caramelo, toffee, frutos oscuros maduros como higos y pasas también presentes. En el retrogusto queda un amargor medio, dulce y con persistencia ligera de las características de la barrica. SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio ligero, baja carbonatación. Se siente el alcohol en boca y garganta de forma muy cálida.
Resumen: un excelente barleywine con carácter marcado de la barrica.

Sludgy brown pour with a thin tan head. Aroma of toffee, oak and vanilla. Thin body, but to be expected for a barrel aged beer. It does howerver borderline medium bodied. Taste is full of vanilla, oak & toffee. Sweet finish. Vanilla & bourbon really dominate here. Tons of toffee, vanilla and oak as it warms. Alcohol is very well hidden. No lace.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2016 37cl bottle. Dark caramel brown pour with a thin tan head that disappears almost instantly. The smell is dominated by notes of Heaven Hill whiskey, caramel, together with nuts, raisins, red wine barrel, a bit of smoke and vanilla. The taste is sweet and just a bit bitter, with caramel, maple syrup, apple brandy and bourbon, toffee and molasses. Full body, medium to low carbonation with a sticky sweet and alcohol heavy finish.

375ml bottle. Dark brown with a thin head. Aroma is boozy, fruity, brown sugar, Christmas cake. Same kind of taste, thick and rich with dark fruits and brown sugar. Nice stuff but I was expecting much more from it.

37,5cl bottle at home. Very dark brown colour, brown foamy head that leaves a nice lacing. Big vanilla-bourbon, milky coffee, milky chocolate, butterscotch, caramel, bourbon-y alcoholic warmth in the finish, pleasantly bitter. Aftertaste keeps on building bourbon-y coffee notes, great! Big body, velvety (!) soft, perfectly balanced, low carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2016 Aromat wyra?nie waniliowy, nieco kokosowy, kamelowy, chlebowy, odrobin? owocowy czy alkoholowy, ale spójny i delikatny. Barwa ciemno br?zowa, pod ?wiat?o z rubinowymi przeb?yskami. Piana jasno be?owa, niewielka i niezbyt trwa?a. Smak s?odki zdominowany przez karmel, melano i chleb, wsparte przez alkohol i mnóstwo wanilii oraz kolosa. Pycha. Kr?g?a do tegoej pe?nia, umiarkowane wysycenie oraz lekko kwaskowy, waniliowy i alkoholowy finisz. G?sta i oleista konsystencja. Drogie to, jak czort, ale warte ceny mój top 10, mo?e nawet 5.

12.7 oz bottle thanks to Homers FBW contest. The bottling date looks like it might be 2013, but its a bit hard to read. Aroma is burnt caramel, coconut, chocolate, dark fruits, molasses, booze, wood. Pours muddy brown with a tiny beige head that falls immediately into a thin collar. Taste is sweet, alcoholic, a bit oxidized with sherry notes. Carbonation is very light, mouthfeel syrupy. Masterful, but a tad harsh. I would appreciate more carbonation.

Coffee brown.. sticky tan head with good lacing that lasts for the entire glass.. 

Aroma is caramel, rum, and more than enough raisin.. Fair amount of alcohol as it hits room temp and only then does the wood and bourbon raise its head.

Flavor mirrors aroma but with pronounced vanilla.. some chocolate and the perfect amount of bourbon. body is thick and smooth at the same time.. the excessive carbonation goes away by the end of the glass.

Very very rich and with a sturdy complexity.
Bottle from Saveur beer. Pours brownish with reddish hue. Oak, whiskey, chocolate vanilla port nose. Flavor is caramel oak sweet with long sweet finish. ABV non existant. Great beer

dark brown colour, one inch of stable, creamy beige head; aroma of whisky, herbal liqueur, vanilla, caramel, biscuit, dried plum and figs, some raisins, oak barrel and cherry bonbon chocolate dessert; taste of dried plum and cherry, caramel, vanilla, whisky, dark chocolate and herbal notes; Its a miracle! Be careful with it!

one of two bottles split with benh and thecametron. ben brought em over on his trip to prague. what a guy. cheers yallnever drunk much barley wine before, didnt think it was my thing. these two were some next level shit tho. had this one first i believe. pours inky ruby colour, soft fizz, hardly any head. aroma of bourbon, chocolate, liquorice. so inviting. tasted of marzipan, chocolate icing, butterscotch, sherry trifle, woody hints rounding it off. malty and boozy as fuck, very little hoppiness. totally amazing. one of the best beers ive drunk. cheers again ben

Another absolutely ridiculous beer hauled over to Prague by Benh. Outrageous. I remember us sharing a bottle of the non-Bourbon version many years ago. This was an unbelievably flavoursome blend of wood, vanilla, booze, chocolate, caramel and everything inbetween. I didnt think anything could top this bad boy, then we popped ope the Firestone Sucaba. I started the evening saying that I didnt much care for Barleywine as a style and finished it by drinking to of the best beers of my life - both barleywines. What a time to be alive.

On tap taster at the Lost Abbey/ Port Brewing tasting room in San Marcos, CA. 

Opaque, black-brown with a khaki head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of roasted malt, dark fruit, bourbon, toffee and vanilla. 

Taste of dark fruit, bourbon, alcohol, toffee, dark malt and more dark fruit complexity. 

Full/medium body and medium carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Toronado. Dark amber/brownish with a minimal head. Sweet with dried fruit, bourbon, oak and some warming alcohol.
@ Tornado 16-3-6: fantastisk doft och smak av burbon, nötter och russin. Len eftersmak.

Leicht trübes orange braunes Bier mit einer geringen leicht beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Vanille, Eiche, bourbon, reifes Obst, alkoholisch. Geschmack nach viel Vanille, bourbon, Eiche, sehr vollmundig, leicht alkoholisch, sehr lecker, top!

375cl bottle served in a snifter. Pours deep garnet with little carbonation and a small but short lived sequence of bubbles. Aroma is massive bourbon - too much. Taste is disappointingly one-dimensional with way too much bourbon as though it was poured in neat. Very sweet and syrupy with vanilla notes and underneath quite a nice well-balanced base beer but the barrel aging was just too much. So disappointed with this after Deliverance and Serpents Stout which are both excellent I had high hopes for this.

Pours dark amber/brown color, clean, slightly haze, with diminish off-white/yellowsish color.
Visually low carbonation.
Aroma: intense malt aroma, which takes on toffee, biscuit, caramel, supported with aroma of bourbon, wood, vanilla, stone fruits etc.
Flavor: similar as aroma: dominate malts flavors, which takes on caramel, tofee, molasses, supported with gentle but noticable flavor of bourbon, vanilla, wood, , prunes, resins, some stone frut....
Taste is firstly sweet, caramel/fruity, then immediately steps forward gentle note of bourbon, tannins, fruity esters, and lingers into finish. Finish is sticky dry.
Body is full, texture silky soft, carbonation is low

tap at EBF 2016 - last drop from tommes pitcher. hazy very dark brown pour with a small beige cap, some retention and lacing. dense caramel and toffee - incredible malt depth; rich dripping bourbon, wood, some dark dried red fruits underneath; coconut sweetness. moderately low carbonation, medium to full body - very oily; assertively grassy-spicy balanced by a sweet bourbon finish. a bourbon-soaked fruitcake. excellent!

I had this last night at Tom Hams Lighthouse. It is everything a barrel aged barleyment should be. Big and cerealy with perfectly balancing hops bitterness, a velvety body, warming alcohol, and a moderate bourbon character with moderate to medium oak.

Draft. Pour is deep brown to black with a minimal offwhite head. Aroma of raisins, dried figs, booze, vanilla. Taste is lightly oxidized with papery flavors. Rich chocolate and a lightly tart Belgian character. Pretty damn good.
Bottle, thanks Jon. Aroma is full on, raisin, fruity, booze. Taste is fruity, bourbon, booze, dark fruit, little bit sparkly,

Bottle shared, thanks Jon. An explosion of flavors, toffee, cocoa, dried fruit, coconut, almond, oak, whiskey, long sweet warming finish. Great stuff, devilicious and complex, awesomeness in a bottle.

Poured into a taster showing an opaque dark brown center and light coffee brown rims with no head.

The nose shows moderately intense notes of caramel and bourbon.

The palate is lightly carbonated and medium bodied. A very high alcohol spiciness throughout. Caramel malt flavor throughout with a light vanilla background and sweetness.

Bottle shared. Thanks Jon! Huge bourbon nose with loads of chocolate. Some wheat and dark fruit tones come out as it warms up. Slightly sweet on the palate, but not cloying. More bourbon as it warms up with some vanilla, coconut, oak and grains. This is almost like an imperial stout rather than a barley wine. Huge flavors that get more complex as it warms. Finishes slightly sweet and warming with more of the same flavors standing out. Fantastic.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2017 Cloudy brown color. Sourish nose wish tons of bourbon, vanilla, dark fruit, dried fruit.  Decent sourness, dark fruit and bourbon character. Dark fruits and oak just longer and lingers. Good stuff. Modestly sweet not overly boozy. Having with authentic English Christmas and fuck me, this takes Christmas to the next level.

A nice bourbon barreled beer, but not the most interesting, bourbon sort of overwhelms. Pours a deep black with a tan head. Smells of bourbon and marshmallow. Taste is mostly bourbon, with a bit of marshmallow, vanilla and caramel, and some raisin in the finish. A bit of a strange sweet aftertaste. Had on tap at Billcos.

Bottle to a snifter. Opaque mahogany with thin mocha head. Sweet bourbon, vanilla, salted caramel and cacao... Layers of flavor, dark dried fruit, figs, smooth, balanced boozy finish... What an outstanding beer!!!

On tap @ Chucks CD. Pours murky reddish brown with thin oily mocha head. Aroma is roasty boozy dark caramel malt; fig, raisin, and port come through. Big sweet oaky bourbon notes on the back dominate. Taste is similar - caramel, vanilla, oak, leather, port, hazelnut all appear. Bourbon is heavy here as well, though not as dominant as the nose. Really works well with all the depth here and makes an outstanding beer even better. Some alcohol heat but so much flavor it doesnt really detract. Awesome beer.

Bottle thanks to HopAg. Pours a dark brown with medium beige head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is roast, vanilla, wood, whiskey. Thin mouth, sweet roasted malt, oak, vanilla, nice booze, really enjoyed this one.

2012 bottle split 2 ways. Pours a murky...if not chunky...mahogany color...amber hues, deep brown center. Loads of sediment pollute the glass. To be honest, it was an ugly beer. My expectations dropped almost instantly. The aroma was pretty dang abrasive too. Loads of bourbon sting the nostrils. Some dark fruits, caramel and faint vanilla/oak follow. The flavor was much more impressive. Extremely hot beer with a thin mouthfeel for the style. Just lots of bourbon all over this. Wet oak, plum, mild roasted notes, caramel and vanilla make brief appearances, but the heat on the backend just dominates the profile. It was a chore to get through my pour. Would like to re-visit with a fresh bottle but its not high on my list.

2013 bottle shared by Ryan! Pours a murky deep brown mahogany with a quick thin khaki head that leaves a wispy thin film. Aroma is woody oak bourbon dark fruit brunt caramel. Taste is bitter sweet sugar burnt caramel bourbon dark pitted fruit. Palate is full slick drying and warming. Really glad I finally had this.

3 oz bottle pour at ChurchKey. 2010 vintage. Dark brownish black with no noticeable head. Aromas of whiskey, coffee, chocolate. Tastes of chocolate, roast, light booze and whiskey. Medium body with a dry finish. Barrel character probably faded by now.

Caramelized barley and some booze. A hint of oak and almost a water sense here. Pours black without much head. Syrupy and somewhat sweet. Not sure about the hype on this. The regular one I liked better. 2010 bottle pour at Churchkey.
A: Deep brown/red, no head but thin lacing. N: Chocolate, vanilla, apricot, blackberry, leather T: Chocolate, vanilla, leather, liqourice O: Wow! Sweet chocolate bourbon heaven!

10/4/2011 2:12:05 PM Bottle with Rick at the Beer Temple. Dark brown amber body with hardly a head. Nose is sweet, caramel, bourbon and vanilla. Taste is also dark brown, malty. Lots of vanilla in there. What a smooth and silky drink. Really, really silky. Warming in the finish. Enjoyed it immensely.
Deep brown color with no head or lacing. Aroma of vanilla, bourbon, molasses, and wood. Vanilla, booze, toffee, and dark fruit flavor. Most excellent!

375 mL bottle poured into a CBS snifter. No bottle date. Originally reviewed 7/17/2012.
Pours a dark brown, translucent at the edges, opaque everywhere else. Lots of chunky sediment near the end of the bottle. No head. Flat as hell.

Smell is Bourbon, vanilla, lots of booze. Toffee and burnt sugar. Booze. Whoa.

Taste is Bourbon, vanilla, oak as well. Barrel is strong. Lots of vanilla and toffee. Sweet. Oaky and boozy. Buttery in the finish. Oaky and just a touch bitter in the finish.

Flat. Thick, but not too syrupy. Boozy and not easy to drink.

This was much better on tap. The carbonation probably has a lot to do with it. This is my first flat Lost Abbey bottle. I did pretty well to make it this far into my beer career without a flat LA bottle, I think. Good beer. Bummer about the carbonation.

Bottle. .. Dark brown with a small dissipating off white head. Aroma of caramel, vanilla and sherry. Tastes similar to the nose but with a touch of bitter sawdust. As a woodworker I do not consider this sawdusty flavor particularly objectionable. Good stuff.
KRS 140315 Dark brown colour with a beige head. Flavour is bourbon, alcohol, dried fruits, chocolate, caramel, raisin, molasses. Full body. Very nice beer.

375ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours very dark brown with no head. Aroma is fudge, coffee, raisins, cough syrup, bourbon and salty liquorice. Flavour is sweet. Full bodied, oily texture, no carbonation. Finish is sweet and warming alcohol.

August 21, 2015. Bottle at home, vintage 2012, or 2013.
Dark brown, almost black with a very small tan head. Aroma is caramel, figs, raisins, figs, bourbon alcohol, milk chocolate and vanilla. Taste is sweet caramel dried fruits, light bitter roasted notes and slight bourbon alcohol. Finish is sweet, light bitter and warming alcohol. Medium to full bodied, oily texture and very soft carbonation.
Bottle @ ZEBF 2015. Aroma of bourbon vanilla, raisin and malt. Rich taste of bourbon booze vanilla, coffee, raisin and surprisingly some mild apple. Great beer.

Neck of bottle states bourbon 2013. Not sure where I got. Wondering if not stored properly. Very good but I didnt get some details that most others did. Pour was sludgy dirty brown with no head. Aroma was dark fruits and caramel. No alcohol for me. Great palate. Taste similar to aroma. No hops actually wished for some shops to balance sweetness. Would love to try again fresh not sure I missed some of what this was supposed to be

Dark ambery brown with a slight ringed head. Nose is bullish coconut and booze with a sidestep of sweetness. Initial taste is a leanly bitter, lush sweetness and fades with a sweet BBQ. Soft carbonation and vibrant lingering mouthfeel. Finishes softly sweet, nice coconut buzz. Bottle, Cotteridge Wines Whole Lotta Rosie Tasting

Bottle. Dark brown with tan head. Aroma is nutty. chocolate, tootsie roll, toffee, dried fruits, dark fruit, prune. Similar taste, toffee, tootsie roll, wood, vanilla, coconut, dried fruit, sherry, dates. Sweet and bitter
Bottle at Craigs. Pours dark brown with no head. Aromas of wood, bourbon, prunes. Taste is more of the same. Hot finish.
Bottle at craigs. Pours black, nose is toffee, vanilla, coconut, wood, taste is similar, sweet, chewy.

375 ml corked bottle from Beergium.com
Black body, with a tiny, quickly disappearing, brownish head.
Delicious, rich aroma of bourbon, oak barrel, coconut, vanilla, red wine, some chocolate, booze.
Taste is pretty alcoholic, with bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, some coffee, liquorice, dark and dried fruits.
Full, oily mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes alcoholic, warm, pretty astringent, with bourbon, coffee, bitter chocolate, some dark fruits and long-lasting barrel notes.

Tasty, heavy sipper. The nose is amazing, while the taste doesnt fully live up in my opinion, too much alcohol, but still very enjoyable. A bit less alcohol and this would be quite perfect for me. Overall a great Barley Wine, but not the best Ive had.

Bottle. Pours black with thin head that clings to the edges. Mild carbonation and boozy vanilla aroma. A bit thin for the style. I like the complexity in the boozy flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Underbar doft av sötma, ekfat, Bourbon, dadlar, fikon och russin. Smaken liknar doften med tillägg av en värmande alkohol och en munkänsla som balanserar fint mellan oljig och tunn. En av mina favoritöl, mycket, mycket god.
Testad på Linköping Beer Expo. Grumligt mörkbrun färg. Inget skum. Mycket doft av torkad frukt och tydliga toner av bourbon. Lite toner av vin i smaken blandat med vanilj och dadlar. Mycket god!

Bottle. Pours dark brown in color with a tan head. Dark fruitynyess, vinous notes, some oak with bit of chocolate on the side in aroma. Nice. Vanilla and sweet brown sugary syrup too. Rich. Theres a nice mix between toffee and chocolate together with some dark fruityness in taste. Ripe plums and raisins covered with a whiff of smoke in finish. A really smooth one, and good tasting too.

Bottle, 375ml corked. A very dark brown one, almost flat, but with some beige bubbles. The aroma has lots of dried fruits and alcohol. Prunes, some caramel and chocolate, hints of molasses and raisins. Its full-bodied and warming on the palate, with some bitterness in the back, trying to deal with the sweetness. Prunes, raisins, caramel, some molasses and chocolate in the flavor. Lasting finish with loads and loads of flavors. It wouldnt hurt to have this one at a slightly lower ABV, but its sure a lovely one anyway. 150314

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a tiny beige head. Aroma of alcohol, bourbon, roasted malt, chocolate, some soy sauce and grains. Flavor is sweet and warming alcohol, bourbon, oak, caramel, biscuits and grains. Full body, soft carbonation.

Si presenta di color tonaca di frate / marrone scuro, torbido, senza formare nessuna schiuma o pizzo nel bicchiere. Laroma è gradevole, sentori di legno, di cuoio, caramello, prugna disidratata e uvetta, per un risultato che richiama senza molti dubbi laroma di un Porto. In bocca è calda e morbida, completamente piatta, con un corpo medio ed una consistenza oleosa; lalcool è ben in evidenza, riscalda tutta la bevuta ed aumenta dintensità nel finale, regalando delle note che richiamano un bourbon e che si alternano a quelle di vino ossidato (prugna, ciliegia, uvetta, fico).

Draught. Pours a very dark brown color with a moderate light brown head on there. Nose has some caramel and bourbon mixed in nearly perfect proportion. Taste has a hintnof boze, but remains smooth and slightly sweet with hints of wood and caramel. Really nice brew.

375 ml bottle with print "bourbon 2012". Mahogany color with brown foam. Very powerful aroma: plums, gooseberries, blueberries, jam, caramel, vanilla, bourbon, smoke and alcohol semitone, port, cocoa, coffee, marmalade, vanilla, oak. Powerful wine flavor, mixed with bourbon, vanilla, oak wood, slightly oxidized, forest herbs, caramel. Great example of barley wine!

Pours reddish dark brown, little head. Lots of bourbon, oak on the nose. Taste is sweet, butterscotch, toffee, vanilla, more oak. I can appreciate the complexity of this, but it the end its too much/too sweet for me. As a dessert pairing it is probably great.

So ye, finally got around to this bad boy. The last of the "Angels shares" I opened was a sour mess of bad sour dough infection, so I was a bit skeptical buying another... Oh well, I did, and how glad am I to have done so. 
Pours dark, murky coke like brown, with as good as no head what so ever, with a nice amount of alcohol lacing. 
Aroma is pretty darn packed with boozy bourbon gewy goodness, banana, vanilla, oak, caramel, some sugary nuts, dark fruits soaked in bourbon, molasses. Does smell a lot like port wine. 
Taste is pretty darn sweet, with some faint bitter notes at the back, walking hand in hand with the slight heat of the 12,5 abv. 
Medium and oily body, with no carbonation (surprised right?) 
The Angels share was on the first BW I ever had the pleasure of drinking, and this really took me back to the rookie days.

Bottle split 4 ways. Dirty brownish pour with some tiny lacings. Nose has loads of bourbon notes, caramel, vanilla and butter. Taste is fairly sweet, toasted, vanilla, caramel and sweet malts. Good stuff!

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2015 Egy kevés utánajárást azért megkövetelt, mire arra a megállapításra jutottam, hogy a kezemben lévő Lost Abbey darab a Bourbon Barrel verziót testesíti meg, mivel az üveg címkéje nem feltétlenül nyújt egyértelmű iránymutatást az ügyben. A Ratebeer honlapján az alap verzió és a bourbon hordóban érlelt típus címkéje sem passzol azzal a változattal, amit az utóbbi főzet neve alatt szerepeltetve alkalmam volt megszerezni, az interneten rendelkezésre álló fotók azonban a birtokomban lévő üveg képét örökítik meg a "Bourbon Barrel" karakterrel felruházott ital vonatkozásában. Kólaszín-árnyalatú testére halovány habréteg ül, keskeny karimájú fedelet rajzolva az italra. Az illatai egyszerűen utánozhatatlanok, a legelegánsabb barley wine-aromák, amiket valaha éreztem. A puha selyemcukros, édesített paradicsomleves, fodormentás és pillecukros csemege hangulata kóstolásra buzdít, hívogató aromái egyszerre simák és feltűnésmentesek, ugyanakkor megismételhetetlenül egyedi stílusúak, kókuszos fahordós, vajas bourbon-karakterű, mazsolás hangulatúak. Ízvilága a mennyei manna körvonalait hordozza, keserédes datolya és füge, mályvacukor, vaníliás whisky jegyeit jeleníti meg, vakító élénkségű aromái apró szénsavbuborékokkal tarkított kortyokban öltenek testet, melyek olajosan csúsznak. A hordóérlelés jótékony hatása már-már tökéletesnek ható szerkezetet biztosít a főzetnek, a karakteres árpaborok szerelmesei mindenesetre ne keresgéljenek tovább.

Bottle, 35cl. Pours a dark dark brown with an oily, short lasting, off white head. Aroma has lots of sweet buttery bourbon, oak, caramel, dark, toasted caramel malts, slight sweet licorice, alcohol. Taste is again very sweet and caramelly. So much nice bourbon, again some sweet licorice, coconut, vanilla. Very oaky as well. Smooth, greasy body, low carbonation. Buttery sweet. Good stuff!

Bottle. Pours greasy black with a thin shortlasting small offwhite head. Aromas of bourbon, vanilla, malt, chocolate, raisins, dates, alcohol. Taste is bourbon up front, vanilla, raisins, dates, chocolate, malt, barley, dry woody notes, licorice in the end.

375ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Dark brown almost black color with dark beige head. Malty caramel aroma, chocolate, dark fruits, bourbon, vanilla, wood, alcohol. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2016 Bottled. Pours deep amber with a small head. aroma of roasted malts, raisins, vanilla, bourbon and overripe fruits. Sweet flavour that ends up more dry with some alcohol too. Full bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A great Barley indeed. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Bottle shared by Damian and Lona. Easily one of the most amazing beers Ive ever had. Dark brown with nice tan head. Aroma and taste are perfect, booze, caramel, malts, and the most ridiculous vanilla.
Draft - Bourbon, vanilla notes and chocolate. Dirty row with a decent beige head. Boozy, cocoa and a nice malty sweet vanilla finish. Lots of sweet bourbon.

Draft at Chucks. So much for my productive work morning. Murky brown pour with very little head. Beautiful nose. Raisins, figs, vanilla, molasses. The filling for grandmas date pinwheel cookies, spiked with whiskey when she wasnt looking. Taste is sweet; smooth alcohol burn that you can feel moving down your throat and into your belly. Lightly bitter finish. Afterwards the mouth is coated with the residue, so the flavor lasts and lasts. Sticky (in all the best ways). Palate: full body, slick sticky texture, light carbonation. Overall: yep, this beer (on draft) is good no matter what barrel it goes into.

Bottle @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, malty, roasted malt, caramel and bourbon. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. 220115
Mmmmmmhhhhhh yummy.. Nice head with good suration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are bourbon, vanilla, feuits, malt and hops. Nice!
Dark ruby colour, no head. Aroma of bourbon, dark fruits, citrus. Taste is medium sweet, very well balanced. Full body, creamy texture, soft to flat carbonation. Very nice.

2014 edition. 
Poured from a 12.7 oz bottle into a tulip on 12.05.14.

A: Lots of vanilla and caramel. 

A: It has a ring of fizz that quickly recedes to nothing. Opaque purple body with some lighter purple at the bottom and sides. Sediment is there too.

T: Vanilla and caramel dominate. A tiny bit of woodiness is subtle.

P: Syrupy smooth. There arent many bubbles. Its not flat but maybe undercarbonated.

O: The alcohol heat was definitely there. It looks and feels like a liquoer. Its not very complex, but it has nice flavors.

A dark brown beer with a very weak and beige head. The aroma is rich, lots of raisins and dried dark fruits, madeira wine, some vanilla and bourbon. Sweetness is balanced and its slightly syrup with dried fruits. Rich and great aroma. Taste has lots of raisins and madeira wine, dark fruits, some barrel. Warming alcohol but no taste. Propably, the barrel is reducing the sweetness and thus the sweetness is balanced. Full bodied, slightly sticky, no carbonation. Complex and enjoyable beer without too much of sweetness, even the flavours has strong sweet elements. Strong raisins. Balanced barrel, it would be nice to taste the normal version also.

Bottle @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Dark brown with tiny head. Aroma is malt, dark fruits, oak, vanilla, bourbon, plume and chocolate. Flavour is malt, dark fruits, oak, wood, plume, chocolate, sweet, vanilla, bourbon, little plume and a little bitter.
On tap at wholeach fodds wrxford. Cola colored great bourbon fragrsnve. The high suger level smooths it all ouy. A dessert drink for sipping

Bottle. Dark brown. Whiskey oak barrel in aroma, wood, rich malts, vanilla. Vinous, dark fruity light leathery. Med bodied, surprisingly easy for the abv. Really tasty, without being overpowering. Malty, oaky, real nice. Don’t think I’ve been this,pleased since that tommy’s- one from the same brewery.-- bb

375 ml Bottle (2008 version) at Local Option, Chicago. Poured a dark murky brown with a round off white head and a super rich consistency. The aroma is strong raisin, red berry fruit, malt and alcohol. The flavour is strong bitter with a rich raisin fruit malt alcohol weak liqourice oaky palate. A super rich consistency beer. The alcohol is well controlled for the ABV which makes it a great.

Bottle 0.375l at home, Nivala. Colour is almost black with very small brownish head. Aromas and flavors: Dark chocolate, hints of licorice, bourbon, sweetness, wood, dark/dry fruits, hints of vanilla and roasted malts. Great but too much bourbon. Have another bottle in cellar so have to check after 2-3 years if it is getting softer and better.

Bottle from saveur bier. Almost black color, tanned head. Aroma is amazing balanced, sweet notes, bourbon, whiskey, oak. Taste is same, balanced, licorice, plums, sweet fruity notes and bourbon notes.

(Bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Dec 15 2014) Pours slightly murky dark mahogany with a tiny off white ring of bubbles. Aroma dominated by that Heaven Hill bourbon barrel with its oak, moderate char, toasted coconut, vanilla, and the whiskey itself. Behind that there is sweet dark toffee malt with a touch of dried dark fruit (date, fig?) - malts are quite robust to hold all that barrel but dont lead. On the palate, elegant with the fairly rich malt core of toffee, caramel, stewed dark fruit playing support to the barrel again. Lots of oak and bourbon throughout the palate, char is light, coconut notes quite prominent Finish is pretty long but smooth with almost no alcohol character, just bourbon barrel flavours and malts. Fairly full oily body with very little carb. Barrel to the fore, sure, but this beer is so easy to sip and not brash or boozy. Like the most drinkable bourbon ever.
2011 bottle. Smell is bourbony, malty, and a slight bit of booze. Taste is rich malt and bourbon. Body is medium to thick and completely flat.

Bottle to glass. Pours a deep nut brown color with a thin medium brown head. Aroma is a huge matls, vanilla, light bourbon. Flavor is big, creamy, malty sweet, lots of bourbon and vanilla, phenomenal. Medium to heavy creamy body with a long lingering creamy vanilla and bourbon. Absolutely wonderful!

Draft at HOTB. poured a muddy brown. Little head. Aroma of whisky bourbon. Complex. Nice oak flavors. Vanilla notes. Nice texture. Smooth. Well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Dark syrupy brown. Bourbon and caramel aroma. The taste follows and adds brown sugar. Warm sticky mouthfeel, low carb. Boozy. Excellent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Dark ruby/cola with no head. Aroma is dark fruit, fusel alcohol, maple syrup and butter. Taste follows closely. Thick sticky mouthfeel. Nice.

375ml bottle, 2013 vintage. Wonderful aroma consisting of vanilla, oak, caramel and just the slightest hint of booze. Pours extremely dark brown with a reddish hue to it and a very thin light tan head with no lacing. Starts with sweet caramel and oak. Finishes extremely smooth with a lot of vanilla and more wood. Rich, full bodied beer that is extraordinarily smooth. An excellent, well-balanced bourbon ale that highlights the barrels used. Simply amazing!

2008 vintage bottle pour split along side with the current Angels Share. Thanks again T for making this happen. Pours black with a thin tan head that will stick around. Sweet graham cracker, marshmallow like aroma. Super sweet flavor. Very smooth flavor all the way through. Just a solid, heavy big league beer all around. Really enjoy the Angels share beers, and actually liked this one a little better than the regular. Great stuff.

375ml bottle served in a snifter glass.
A: Pours a cloudy brown color. No head is formed. No lacings are left
S: Smell is great. Strong on wood and whiskey (Oh yeah! :)). Toffee, Caramel, roasted malts and alcohol
T: Delicious. Sweet upfront: toffee and caramel malts. Oak. Roasted malts bitterness. And some earthy hops bitterness too
M: Heavy body. Really molasses. Low carbonation. Sweet upfront and pleasant bitter aftertaste
O: Very drinkable. Excellent beer
[ BA Review @ 7/28/2012 ]

Bottle. Ahhhhh.! This is a beauty in every thinkable way. Pours dark with a red hue and with no head at all. Fabulous aroma with sweet prunes, dark fruits, molasses and oak, as well as chocolate and some pleasant whiffs of liquorice and alcohol. Body is oily, soft and velvety without carbonation. Flavour is sweet with roasted malts and caramel, as well as liquorice, coffee and chocolate and nice sweet barrels of oak with vanilla and molasses making for an excellently sweetly balanced finish sticking forever. What an exceptional brew!

Pours black with no head. Aromas of caramel, raisins, burnt sugar, oak, figs, dates, leather, tobacco. Taste is caramel, dates, raisins, figs, burnt sugar, toffee, smoked bacon. Mouthfeel is very smooth with no carbonation. Fantastic!

Bottle: dark brown-black with thin off-white head. Aroma is boozy bourbon with brown sugar and molasses. Flavor has a lot a of chocolate, sweet caramel, bourbon, and barrel notes with a boozy kick. Big overall beer with lots of flavor which could use some aging to settle. More/better flavor comes out as it warm. Still a great beer.
Pours very dark, with a small tan head. Buttery, boozy, wood aromas up front, lead to a smooth caramel, sweet cocoa, toffee taste on medium to full bodied palate. Excellent.
Bottle. Pours black with tan head . Aroma is strong of figs, chocolate, roasty, sweet. Taste is thick, rich, vanilla. Very good.
Brown iced coffee pour good legs. Aroma whiskey wood. Tastes like bourbon, wee heavy, caramel, vanilla, choco. Alcohol apparent.
On tap at the Red Hot. Dark brown. Thick tan head. Scent is bourbon and booze. Taste is very sweet, caramel, alcohol and bourbon. Smooth beer.

Corked 37.5 cl bottle @ home (2012 vintage). Pours dark brown with a lot of sediment and a tan head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are bourbon, vanilla, oak, chocolate, dark fruits, and caramel - with an alcoholic finish.

From bottle : Pours a very dark brown, not really able to see through...Small brown head. The aroma is strong in alcohol, but also strong in oak and vanilla. But when you go to taste it, almost all of the alcohol disappears. It goes down so smooth. The taste is light and sweet. The finish is pleasant as well. I truly understand why reputation of this brew is what it is. Fantastic.

Muddy murky dark brown, little head. Smells of chocolate covered cherries, funky, vanilla, caramel malt, brown sugar, toffee. Taste of chocolate, toffee, espresso, brown sugar, very little hops, some barrel character, a slight spice or alcohol burn at the end. Nice malt flavors, complex, enjoyable sipper. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 2008 version. Dark brown with no head. Tobacco, wood, coconut, plums, prunes, alcohol, brown sugar/syrup. Full body, oily/sticky texture, flat carbonation, heavy sweet but has some tannins and alcohol to challenge the sweetness. Warming and heavy sipper.

Bottle at home on a cold and rainy spring night. 2011 Vintage. Pour is murky brown with a small tan head and decent lacing. Huge raisin, vanilla, roasted dates, oak, bread, oxidation, prunes, caramel, toffee, and deep bourbon notes in the aroma. Taste is caramelized sugars, raisins, grapes, tangy malt, charred wood, toffee, light earthiness, and cocoa with a light alcoholic burn on the backend. Slick/syrupy mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Roasty, semi-sweet and moderately oxidized Barleywine. Not bad, but need to revisit fresh.

Very dark brown pour, thin tan head that fizzles away. Nose is whiskey, whiskey-soaked raisins, chocolate, lots and lots of chocolate. Taste is bourbon soaked chocolate with dark fruits, a hint of tartness to the finish that balances the sweetness superbly. Medium mouthfeel, sharp carbonation.

Dark molasses brown, dark for a barleywine. Honey and bitter coffee aroma. Terrific taste, things feel in perfect balance. Has this dark, rich, quadrupel-like thing going on. Reminds me a little of Bourbon County Barleywine. Fantastic!
En grymt bra Barleywine fantastisk sötma från bourbon och samtidigt lugn och balanserad.
Fantastic beer. 2009 release. The aroma is plum, raisin and caramel. The taste is similar and very balanced. Low carbonation.

375 ml 2011 bottle. 
Aroma is very rich with lots of dark chocolate and light roast. Strong dark caramel and toffee notes with treacle. Moderate raisin, prune and plum. Medium bourbon notes with light oak and vanilla. Moderately strong alcohol notes. 
Pours black with some dark brown highlights on the edges. Pours pretty much still so no head or lacing. Very long legs. 
Flavor is rich and sweet. Lots of chocolate and dark caramel with light roast, toasted bread and treacle. Faint smokiness. Moderate bourbon character with medium light oak and light vanilla. Medium bitterness. Light plum, raisin and prune. Moderately strong alcohol notes. 
Mouthfeel is fairly full bodied with pretty much no carbonation; this bottle pretty much highlights the Flat Abbey meme. Low astringency and moderate alcohol. 
Overall a really nice beer with great malt complexity. Even with age the alcohol from the bourbon barrels is a bit hot. The complete lack of carbonation also doesnt help this beer; some low carbonation would be a big improvement.

A taste from a guests 375ml bottle @ "Bru Bar Vulkan", Oslo. 
April 18, 2014.
Beer from a snifter glass
Dark red to brown in color with almost no head and low carbonation.
Aroma is malt,alcohol,vanilla,dark dried fruits and oak.
Tastes a bit sweet with vanilla,oak and bourbon.
The beer ends with a bit dry and alcohol taste in the finish.
ABV is absolutely present,but not in a bad way.
Strong. Great aroma, but there is a slight sweetness that disappears as the bourbon and alcohol flavors race against the full flavors of the beer

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2015 Flaska från 2010, 37cl. (Trade med STLWill, thanks!). Dras parallellt mot en vanlig från 2009, ej blint. Inte helt skitenkelt att lista ut vilka som är bourbon, och vad för bourbonfat osv...
Ingen större skillnad i doft. Lite bourbontoner och alkoholdoft. Svagt kolsyrad. Medium/tung kropp. Mörkbrun.

-----
Rerate: (2008) syrlig och flat. Dadlar och fikon. Dourbon i doften. Läder och tobak. Lagrade lätt oxiderade dofter som väntat.

Bottle @ ZZT 9 thanks to Caesar. Dark brown color with a deep red glare coming through, virtually no head. Smell and taste malts, some alcohol, bourbon, a hint of liquorice. Lingering warming alcohol and some bitter. Full body, medium carbonation.
Pours a dark reddids brown beer with no head. Smells bourbon, vanilla. Tastes bourbon, bit alcohol. Nice. Average carbo, medium body and a sticky texture.

Bottle @ZZT9 shared by Caesar. Almost black with a small off-white head. Smells bourbon, almond, nuts, sweet, roasty, chocolate, nice. Tastes roasty, sweet, bourbon, chocolate, nuts. Love. It. Full body, silky, low carbo.

330 ml bottle at home. Pours deep brown with a nice egg-sheel white-greyish colour. Aroma is bourbon, bourbon and some more bourbon with well hidden nuts and raisins, hints of toffee. Medium body with lots of vanilla sweetness and noticeable alcohol butn. Taste is vanilla, cinnamon and sweet cherry oak, caramel and nuts. This is certainly not bad, but why oh why do bourbon barrel aged beers have too much bourbon - I lack a decent balance between the taste of the base beer and the bourbon... I still like it a lot :-).

A fantastic barley wine. Pours a beautiful dark brown with tan head. Aromas of vanilla, bourbon, coconut, dark fruit, brown sugar. Flavors are sweet and malty. Vanilla, grapes, sweet grains. A hot boozy finish. Superb.
Bottle from grape and grain in San Mateo. No head, deep brown color. Can't taste the booze. Nice

Bottle from Healthy Spirits, SF. Pours black with foamy tan head. Wonderful aroma of bourbon, vanilla. Taste of dark fruit, vanilla, dark malts, sweet with a slightly bitter boozy burn in the finish. Full body. Very nice.

2012 bottle. The cork was incredibly difficult to extract. Alas the beer has almost no carb. What did I expect from the lost abbey? Fortunately its not infected. Aroma is bourbon, oak, leathery tannin, and a touch of toffee. The taste is bourbon, vanilla, oak, and oxidation. Its good, although it would be sublime if it wasnt flat.

Bottle 375ml @ Haakonm Pours dark reddish brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, alcohol, dried fruits, oak, vanilla, caramel and bourbon. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter with a long warm, dried fruits and vanilla finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

2013 bottle. Pour is a very dark brown. Aroma is vanilla and Carmel in a bourbony sort of way. Yates has lots of oak bourbon vanilla Carmel. Very sweet for a bourbon stout. No burn. Nice lingering sweet Carmel and vanilla bourbon. This is very good stuff.

Bottle. Dark brown colour, almost black, with no head. Aroma is mostly bourbon and vanilla, with some caramel and malt. Taste is also bourbon, very alcoholic, sweet, caramel and vanilla with hints of raisins. Full body.
Deep raisin color, almost no head. Deep toffee and chocolate aroma, bourbon notes. A bit thin, strong bourbon notes with a little toffee. Nice beer but far from worth the asking price.

2013 vintage. Pours a very dark dark brown. Small but lasting light brown head. Aroma has controlled sweetness, subdued malty, caramel, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oak, . Flavor has much of the same but with a bit more light chocolate, roast. Medium body. Soft. Pleasant alcohol warmth and bourbon character through the finish. I like that it isnt too big or over the top. The bourbon barrel character definitely takes center stage here. Complex. Outstanding.

2011 Version

Aroma: Sweet Bourbon, Vanilla, Brown Sugar

Appearance: Dark Brown Hue, Passes Mild Light, White Head Ring, Minimal Lacing

Taste: Smoothe Bourbon, Brown Sugar, Mild Vanilla

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium to Full Bodied, Semi Boozy, mildly Sweet

Hey Tomme, stop releasing this series until you can work out the details, or just put it on tap so we can go ahead an carbonated it for you as it seems to be very difficult.
2009 Bourbon version.

A: I struggle to pull the plug on this one. It reminds me of decorking a wine bottle; I say this because it has so little carbonation evident on the corking, that there cant be any carb. So I pour it, and here we are: flat as Kansas. Dark brown. No lacing. Hazy even at the edges.

S: Bourbon, minerals, maybe a hint of urine. Lots of sweet malt. A little over the top with the minerals. Some raisin.

T: The bourbon is again, quite strong. It then reminds me of a good helping of burnt peanuts or peanut butter on burnt toast. Hints of dark raisin and dark chocolate.

M: Well, without any carbonation, Im left with a cloyingly sweet and thick ale. Dry finish. Shit.

O: Well, I have had Brandy and Bourbon version several times. I will no longer be purchasing Angels Share. Tomme cant manage to do properly and appears to be too proud to make it right.

Serving type: bottle

07-13-2011

Poured into a tall tulip glass and head barely any head that disappeared immediately. Had a dark red to brown color. Great in the nose sweetness and bourbon. Hints of dark malts with an aggressive boozy dry finish that is almost creamy. Great beer!
Pours dark reddish black with thin head. Aroma is toffee dark fruits and oak bourbon great nose. Taste is rich dark sweet fruits with a dry alcohol burn finish, great beer

Wow intense nose! Very aggressive and boozey. Light body in the world of barley wines. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Huge oaky boozy aroma, some vanilla, raisins, bourbon. No head. No carbonation but it does not matter that much. The oak is dominant but this beer is big! I find some yeasty hints also. Warm finish. Nice winter sipper.

Location/Date:Bottle split with Dave on November 30th, 2013.
Appearance: Pours a dark black. 
Aroma: Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, and chocolate.
Taste: Chocolate, light bourbon, vanilla.
Palate:Medium, smooth.
Summary: This is definitely different than many barleywines Ive had. More on the chocolate, hint of bourbon but not overpowering on the booze. Really nice.

Nice sweet whiskey aroma, which I assume is the bourbon. Caramel notes as well. Pretty burgundy color that was smooth and syrupy. No head to speak of. Carbonation was mild. Any more would not have worked. Very oily and viscous texture. The OG much have been pretty high. Sweet malt flavors with vanilla and toffee. A strong flavor of whiskey with alcohol notes. Definitely a sipping beer and great example of this brewerys prowess.

Intense caramel maltiness, sweet bourbon, raisins, noticeable vanilla, dried dark fruits, intense aroma of wood, decent hops. Complex aroma bomb. Smooth and nicely warming finish. Bit sticky. Not too pushy sweetness.
Another huge brew by Lost Abbey. Price/performance makes this "must have at least once"
Whiskey , fruits, stipra pura, loti salds, fantastisks aroma, lasting putu sega, nav paraak biezs ka varetu likties

2008 bottle shared at Levis house. Uncarbonated. Rich leathery tobacco bourbon chocolate tones. Caramel bourbon juice. Sweet, lovely beverage. Delicious, but the lack of carbonation hurts the overall.

On tap at Urge during their Black Sabbath SDBW event. Pours a dark brown-black with a one finger tan head with nice lacing. Aroma is of dark fruits, moderately roasted malts, burnt caramel, molasses, oak, bourbon, raisins, candied fruits, and some vanilla. Taste is very similar to the aroma with some amazing oak notes, dark caramel, candied fruits, vanilla, molasses, and some rum like notes. Has a full body with a super creamy mouthfeel and a slightly bitter, long finish. Overall, a truly amazing beer that incredibly has almost no noticeable booze and is defiantly the best Barley Wine I have tasted to date.

375 ml bottle from trade with Crajun. Thanks Kevin! Pours a murky dark brown with a small fizzy head that fades to a ring. Aroma has a big oaky vanilla taste from the barrel with some nice dark fruit, cocoa, caramel, cookie dough, and raisins. Some alcohol starts to show up when it warms. Taste is moderately sweet and fairly boozy. The barrel flavor is strong, I wish the base beer would come through just a bit more. Becomes a touch hot when it warms. Medium body. Good BB barleywine but Ive had many better.

Deep brown with ruby highlights and little head. Aroma of vanilla, heavy dark fruit. heavy caramel. Taste of rich velvety sweetness, vanilla, bourbon, caramel, creamy dark toffee. Palate warming and sweet.

Snifter on tap (~12 oz). Dark brown color, no head, opaque, no lacing. Very rich smell, definitely see the bourbon in this one - surprisingly little beer smell actually. Man they must have used a pretty small barrel, it is EFFECTIVELY (potently) aged, man. You have to adjust your expectations when drinking a beer of this magnitude. I taste cocoa nibs, cookies, rich macaroons, some dark plums, strong alcoholic finish. This is a "one and done" type of beer. Definitely a singeing alcoholic burn that is reminicent of taking a small shot after every taste. Medium-low carbonation. My burps taste like whiskey, fuck you. Warm aftertaste, warm. I like regular barley wines a bit better, not sure Im down with barrel aging.

Not as thick but reminds me a lot of Weyerbachers Insanity. Very similar in look and taste. It would be interesting to do a blindfold taste with the two. Nonetheless, this British barley wine is delicious albeit a bit pricey. Off to buy another one (hiccup).

Gravity dispense at GBBF 13, 15/08/13.
Mid black with a thin tan head that dissipates edgeward.
Nose is bourbon infused oak, sweet brown sugars, dark toffee fudge, booze stewed dark fruits.
Taste comprises dark toffee, demerara sugars, light chocolate strains, dark fruits, bourbon, light spice.
Full bodied beast, soft on the palate with fine carbonation and warming alcohol in the finish.
Good shit. The alcohol is well integrated for the ABV.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Binnys. Bourbon 2013 in green on neck. Poured dark brown color you cant see through with light tan head. Very pleasant bourbon that fills my nose. Quite smooth and sweet bourbon taste, light fruit.

Bottle thanks to tleaver33. Big thanks. Bottle pours a deep reddish brown to black with a tan colored head that stats for about 2 minutes. Aroma of sweet bourbon and dark fruits like figs. A bunch of vanilla and some alcohol. The taste is sweet with some vanilla accents and a slight heat. There is a caramel taste at the end along with the heat. The carbonation is spot on and the feel is silky smooth. Definitely my favorite barley wine to date.

Color caoba/rojizo oscuro, sin espuma. El aroma es principalmente de licor, afrutado, pasas y con presencia clara de madera. En boca es densa y muy compleja. De inicio un dulzor afrutado e intenso, que pronto se mezcla con un potente sabor a madera, mas bien seco, que acaba con un final a licor cálido y agradable. Excelente!!

Third of a pint at the Great British Beer Festival 2013. Black with a short-lived head. Fabulous bourbon and vanilla aroma. Light, sweetness, super smooth taste, with a velvet mouth feel and some vanilla notes. Outstanding.
Cask at GBBF 2013 15/08/13. Big and boozy with prunes, rum, sherry, treacle, whiskey and more whiskey! And more booze.

Last bit of bottle, 2013 vintage. Hazy brown color. Thin khaki head. Couple spots of lace. Nice dark fruity bourbon and wood barrel aroma. Some caramel malt, light spice. Awesome bigger body. Smooth, lighter creamy carbonation. Bigger bitter taste. Light sweet. Perfect amount of heat. Great, tasty stuff.

Cask at GBBF 2013, Olympia, London. A dark brown/black coloured pour with virtually no head to speak of. Sweet, boozy, rich aroma. Tastes sweet, chocolate, vanilla, whiskey very boozy and really rich.

Cask at GBBF 2013. Very dark brown, near opaque, almost no head. Aroma is dark choc, roasted malt, vanilla, bourbon whiskey. The first sniff is delicious with the dark chocolate and vanilla coming through, but from there on in its all over powering bourbon whiskey. Taste is over powering sickly sweet. All bourbon whiskey with hints of marmalade, roasted malt and sweetness. Its like bourbon has been poured in. Cloying and overpowering with no balance.
Cask at gbbf 2013. Aroma is sweet caramel creme brulee. Clear rich caramel red pour with no head. Vinous full body with booze oak and caramel . hides the alcohol well. Needs a bit more carb.

2010 bottle drank mid 2013. Pour brown with light sediment, still. Aroma is sweet, sour mash, boozy cherries, earthy sludgy sweet coffee. The flavor is balanced but crazy boozy that goes and goes. Feel is woody and drying but kind of silken; a bit dead. Nothing short of incredible.

On tap at Pressbox in Rancho San Diego. Pours a dark burgundy head with almost no head. Nose is malt, vanilla, oak; flavor follows; very boozy. Full mouthfeel. Big beer, not my favorite style but quite good.

2013 bottle. Pours a very dark opaque brown with a small khaki head. Good bit of bourbon on the nose, some nice dark fruits, caramel and vanilla, looots of oak, and a nice chocolatey nose as well. Great bourbony taste, lots of chocolate and vanilla, an almost piney taste, oak, some caramel and syrup, and a hint of dark cherries. Delicious beer from lost abbey yet again. No issues with carbonation this time either.
UPDATED: AUG 20, 2013 Off tap at City Beer  and bottle. Pours very dark with a tan head. Tastes of chocolate, vanilla, oak, and bourbon. Very tasty!

#1 Non-Retired Barleywine on RB and 5th overall after listings like Dave, King Henry and "M". Im excited to try this. Bottle says "2012 Bourbon", enjoyed in a 375ML at 55 F

Pours a sewer water almost nasty old tea pour, and a minor head formed but quickly faded

The nose is incredible. Smells like lovely caramel with heavy vanilla, muscats and cane syrup.

Explosive taste. Incredibly sweet...very very very sweet. I honestly would say im eating cookies and cream ice cream with the amount of vanilla, sugar and creaminess that I get on the taste. VAnilla beans are huge, big velvety caramel and toffee taste but the finish is 100% booze-bomb like I poured an ounce of bourbon into a regular 12oz barleywine.

Overall, heavy, boozy but very thin sweet finish. Not a lot of carbonation but still incredibly drinkable and really a nice treat to try. Not my favorite barleywine but it is pretty good.

Aroma of delicious vanilla, chocolate, oaky cherry chocolate and bourbon. Pours ugly brown with no carbonation or head at all. Flat flat flat and sticky. Taste is amazing with perfect roasty vanilla, chocolate and sweet toffee. This is a perfect tasting beer with no carbonation. Great stuff. Worth savoring.

So good. Pours a murky brown with really no head. Smells of oak, bourbon, and caramel. Taste is smooth sweet bourbon and brown sugar and roasted pecan. A little throat burn in the end. Just awesome stuff.

On tap at Capone's in Norristown, PA. Aged since 2010, but unfortunately did not lose the overwhelming booziness. Had great flavor in the background, but the alcohol completely overwhelmed it. This does not touch the greatness that was Deliverance.

Flaske hos Ole Anders juni-13: helt flat, men hva gjør vel det når det smaker det smaker himmelsk. Det virker som bourbonfat er særdeles velegnet for fatlagring av mørke øl. Indeed an ale for angels and sinners alike. Especially sinners, I hope.

Bottle from M pollack..2009 bottle..Pour is very dark with a medium tan head..Nose is sweet glazed donuts,coconut, bourbon, wood, chocolate..Taste is fudge, bourbon, vanilla, sweetness, amazingness, smooth, coconut..Palate is nice chocolate and bourbon..very well balanced flavors
Extremely malty with a strong caramel, vanilla, bourbon, oak, and burnt sugar flavors.  Has only a hint of hops which help balance out the palate.  Very delicious.

Bottle thanks to Robloc. Pours a darker brown with a ring of beige foam around the perimeter of the glass. Aroma is heavy oak and booze with lots of vanilla and dark fruits. Taste is very heavy on the oak and booze. Some leather and raisins come through. Nice.

Bottle through trade, pours a brown color with red hues and practically zero head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, caramel and some nice barrel notes, outstanding aroma. Taste is very similar with a bourbon bite that finishes with a bit of heat.

Poured a dark opaque brown. Nose is boozy , sherry port wine. Mouthful has the consistency of port wine. Almost no carbonation flavor is rich and intense. A blast of the barrel a hint of fizz. A touch sweet with dark fruit. The barrel carries a lot of the flavor but its backed up by a full bodied beer. More than worth a try. Almost sublime.
Near black pour, very little head. Nose is decadent - bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, toffee. Crazy complex. Tons of barrel aged flavor - vanilla, wood, bourbon. Very nice.

2012 version . Purchased at geers , than  aged  myself a few months . 
Been waitimg to open this one for a long time 
Pour is pretty disapointing . Clear , not even that dark brown . in the glass its dark brown , not nearly comparable to black .. Imperial stout ????
Foam is almost non- existent , a very tini white ring .. 
Bourbon smell , but no overkill 
Soft carbo . Sweet , buttery , bourbon , yet again , not TOO much . Its enjoyable , but as most of the bourbon ba, i almost taste nothing else than bourbon ... I miss beertaste and complexity .. 


Edit ; its a barley wine . Makes a lot more sence ! Dont know why i thought this was on ratebeer as an impy ...
Bottle from Argonauts in Denver.  Strong bourbon flavor, very cloudy appearance.

May 19, 2013 - 2010 bottle from binnys.  Dark brown pour with limited head and spotty lacing.  Aroma was bourbon, wood, caramel and vanilla.  Taste was caramel, vanilla, wood and an mild alcohol burn in the finish.  I really wanted to like this more than I did.  Not quite sure I agree this should be classified as a barley wine.

Bottle, 2012. Pours cloudy dark brown, small tan head dissipates quickly, some lacing. Aroma is bourbon, toffee, caramel, dried fruits. Flavor is the same, medium sweet, light bitter, quite hot. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel. Hot bourbon finish. No tartness (yay), but almost un carbonated. Why is that so hard?
Amazing flavor. Caramel, molasses, raisin, apple, bourbon. Pretty hot, but extremely tasty.

Deep murky brown with pretty much no head. Aroma is bourbon, raisins, booze, hint of chocolate and vanilla. Oily and syrupy mouthfeel, sweet and boozy on the palate but smoother than it smells. Taste is bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, raisins, dates, brown sugar, hint of oak. Quite sweet but delicious! A good after dinner beer.

This beer pours a raisin brown with no head. The nose is raisin, molasses, bourbon and oak. The pallet starts with sweet raisin, followed by bourbon, with a swift kick of oak and finishes with a sweet molasses and brown sugar. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
